intro: Sindora sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran sindora, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Indonesian archipelago. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by woody, elongated fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, lowland forests and is often found in secondary growth areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
